testcase.name: ->run() throws an Exception if command is not found
__construct() returns an application with an argument
__construct() returns an application with an option
->addArgument() throws an InvalidArgumentException if an argument with the same name is added
->addArgument() throws an InvalidArgumentException if there is an array parameter already registered
->addArgument() throws an InvalidArgumentException if you try to add a required argument after an optional one
->getArgument() returns an nbArgument by its name
->getArgument() throws a RangeException exception if the argument name does not exist
->hasArgument() returns true if an nbArgument exists for the given name
->hasArgument() returns false if an nbArgument does not exists for the given name
->countRequired() returns the number of required arguments
->countRequired() returns the number of required arguments
->getDefaultValues() returns the default values for each argument
->getDefaultValues() return the default values for each argument
->getValue() throws if required argument has not been set
->__construct() throws an Exception if the mode is not valid
->isArray() returns true if the argument can be an array
->isArray() returns true if the argument can be an array
->isArray() returns false if the argument can not be an array
__construct() creates a new nbArgumentsSet if none given
__construct() creates a new nbOptionSet if none given
__construct() takes a nbArgumentSet as its first argument
__construct() takes a nbArgumentSet as its first argument
__construct() takes a nbOptionSet as its second argument
__construct() can take a nbOptionSet as its second argument
->addArguments() does not clear the argument set
->addOptions() does not clear the option set
->getOptionValue() returns the value for the given option name
->getOptionValue() returns the value for the given option name
->getOptionValue() returns the value for the given option name
->getOptionValue() returns the value for the given option name

->getOptionValue() returns the value for the given option name
->getOptionValue() throws a nbCommandException if the option name does not exist
->getArgumentValue() returns the value for the given argument name
->getArgumentValue() returns the value for the given argument name
->getArgumentValue() throws a nbCommandException if the argument name does not exist
->isValid() returns false if the arguments are not valid
->isValid() returns false if the arguments are not valid
->isValid() returns false if the options are not valid
->isValid() returns false if the options are not valid
->isValid() returns false if the options are not valid
->isValid() returns false if the options are not valid
->isValid() returns false if the options are not valid
->isValid() returns false if the options are not valid
->parse() with "--" stops parsing the command line
->parse() with command line set as array
->addCommand() throws an InvalidCommandException if an command with the same name is added
->getCommand() returns an nbCommand by its name
->getCommand() throws a RangeException exception if the command name does not exist
->getCommand() returns an nbCommand by its shortcut
->hasCommand() returns true if an nbCommand exists with name "foo"
->hasCommand() returns true if an nbCommand exists with shortcut "f"
->hasCommand() returns false if an nbCommand does not exists with shortcut "bar"
->hasCommand() returns false for shortcut "b" because ambiguous
->hasCommand() returns false for shortcut "ns:b" because ambiguous
->getCommand() returns a valid command for shortcut "f"
->getByShortcut() throw a RangeException for shortcut "b" because ambiguous
->getByShortcut() throw a RangeException for shortcut "ns:ba" because ambiguous
->__construct() returns a command with no arguments
->__construct() returns a command with no options
->setAlias() throws an InvalidArgumentException if command alias already defined
->addOption() throws an InvalidOptionException if an option with the same name is added
->getOption() returns an nbOption by its name
->getOption() throws a RangeException exception if the option name does not exist
->getOption() returns an nbOption by its shortcut
->hasOption() returns true if an nbOption exists for the given name
->hasOption() returns true if an nbOption exists for the given shortcut
->hasOption() returns false if an nbOption does not exists for the given name
->countRequired() returns the number of required options
->countRequired() returns the number of required options
->getDefaultValues() returns the default values for each option
->getDefaultValues() return the default values for each option
->getByShortcut() returns a valid option for shortcut "f"
Couldn't create option with name shorter than 3 letters
Couldn't create option with shortcut longer than 1 letter
->hasShortcut() returns false if option has not shortcut
->hasShortcut() returns true if option has shortcut
->hasParameter() returns true if mode is "nbOption::PARAMETER_OPTIONAL" or "nbOption::PARAMETER_REQUIRED"
__construct() throws "InvalidArgumentexception" if mode is not valid
->getValue() throws LogicException if option has "nbOption::PARAMETER_NONE" mode
->getValue() throws LogicException if option has "nbOption::PARAMETER_REQUIRED" mode and null value
->setValue() throws LogicException if option has "nbOption::PARAMETER_NONE" mode
option with mode "nbOption::PARAMETER_NONE" can't have default value
option with mode "nbOption::PARAMETER_REQUIRED" can't have default value
option with array without mode has no parameter
option can be array with no parameter
option can be array with no parameter
->isArray() returns true if the argument can be an array
->isArray() returns false if the argument cannot be an array
->setValue() must receive an array if option mode is "nbOption::IS_ARRAY"
->getValue() returns an empty array if option has IS_ARRAY mode
->setValue() append parameter to value if option has IS_ARRAY mode
